questions.question: What is the best time to visit Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Cover monsoon vs winter vs summer. Best months are Oct-Mar with temperatures 10-25°C. Include festival dates (Diwali, Baisakhi in April, Guru Nanak Jayanti). Mention crowd levels during peak season and hotel price variations.

questions.question: How many days do you need in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Recommend 2-3 days minimum. Day 1: Golden Temple, Jallianwala Bagh. Day 2: Wagah Border, local markets. Day 3: Durgiana Temple, Ram Tirath. Include half-day options for quick visits.

questions.question: What are the entry timings for Golden Temple?
questions.contentDirection: 24/7 open access. Best times: early morning 4-6 AM for peaceful darshan, evening 7-9 PM for illumination. Include Guru ka Langar meal timings, accommodation booking process for Guru Ram Das Niwas.

questions.question: How to reach Amritsar from Delhi by train?
questions.contentDirection: Cover Shatabdi Express (6 hours, ₹1500-2500), Golden Temple Mail (7 hours, ₹500-1200). Include booking tips, departure times from New Delhi station, advance reservation requirements.

questions.question: What to eat in Amritsar besides kulcha?
questions.contentDirection: Highlight Amritsari fish, lassi at Gian Di Lassi, chole bhature at Brahma Baba ka Dhaba, jalebi at Jalebiwala. Include Kanha Sweets, Bharawan Da Dhaba locations and average meal costs ₹200-500.

questions.question: Where is the famous kulcha in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Top spots: Kulcha Land, Amritsari Kulcha Hub near Golden Temple, Monu Kulcha Shop in Majitha Road. Include varieties (aloo, gobi, paneer), prices ₹60-120, and eating etiquette with white butter.

questions.question: How much does Wagah Border ceremony cost?
questions.contentDirection: Free entry to general stands. VIP seating ₹100-300. Include timing (summer 6:15 PM, winter 5:15 PM), advance booking for premium seats, travel time from city center (45 minutes).

questions.question: What to buy in Hall Bazaar Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Cover Phulkari dupattas (₹800-3000), leather juttis (₹300-1500), dry fruits, traditional suits. Include bargaining tips, shop timings, and walking route from Golden Temple (15 minutes).

questions.question: Is Amritsar safe for solo female travelers?
questions.contentDirection: Generally safe around Golden Temple complex. Include precautions for late evening markets, recommended areas to stay (Heritage Walk area), local transport safety, and emergency numbers for tourists.

questions.question: What is the dress code for Golden Temple?
questions.contentDirection: Cover head covering requirement (scarves available free), no shoes policy, modest clothing guidelines. Include where to deposit shoes (free cloak room), washing feet at entrance, tobacco/alcohol restrictions.

questions.question: How far is Jallianwala Bagh from Golden Temple?
questions.contentDirection: 5-minute walk (400 meters). Include entry fee ₹30 for Indians, ₹500 foreigners. Visiting hours 10 AM-6 PM. Cover key memorial spots, bullet marks on walls, martyrs' well.

questions.question: Where to stay near Golden Temple Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Budget: Hotel Grace (₹1500-2500), Mid-range: Hotel Hong Kong Inn (₹3000-5000), Luxury: Taj Swarna (₹8000+). Include walking distance to temple, parking availability, advance booking needs during festivals.

questions.question: What is special about Guru ka Langar at Golden Temple?
questions.contentDirection: Free community kitchen serving 100,000+ daily. Include meal timings, volunteering opportunities, dining hall (capacity 5000), donation process. Cover simple dal-roti menu and community service philosophy.

questions.question: How to book accommodation at Golden Temple?
questions.contentDirection: Online booking at sgpc.net for Guru Ram Das Niwas and Guru Arjan Dev Niwas. Include rates ₹500-1500, advance booking (30 days), required documents, check-in process near Ghanta Ghar.

questions.question: What are the famous gates of Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Cover Hall Gate (shopping), Lahori Gate (historic significance), Hakiman Gate area. Include historical background from Sikh period, current landmarks near each gate, local transportation hubs.

questions.question: Where to experience Amritsari nightlife?
questions.contentDirection: Limited nightlife - focus on evening activities: Golden Temple illumination, rooftop restaurants like Sher-e-Punjab, Café Coffee Day outlets, late-night food streets near Guru Bazaar until 11 PM.

questions.question: What is the cost of Amritsar food tour?
questions.contentDirection: Organized tours ₹2000-4000 per person. DIY food crawl ₹500-800. Include stops: Kulcha Land, Kesar Da Dhaba, Gurdas Ram Jalebi Wala, Ahuja Milk Bhandar for lassi. Duration 4-5 hours.

questions.question: How to reach Durgiana Temple from railway station?
questions.contentDirection: 3 km distance, auto-rickshaw ₹80-120, bus route from platform. Temple timings 4 AM-11 PM. Include architectural similarity to Golden Temple, Lakshmi Narayan temple complex, free entry.

questions.question: What are the best rooftop restaurants in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Sher-e-Punjab with Golden Temple view, Bhrawan da Dhaba rooftop, Hotel CJ International terrace dining. Include average meal costs ₹800-1500, reservation requirements, sunset timing views.

questions.question: Where to buy authentic Phulkari in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Hall Bazaar shops, Katra Jaimal Singh market. Include authentic vs machine-made identification, price ranges ₹1500-8000, bargaining from 40-50% quoted price, export quality certificates.

questions.question: What is the Partition Museum Amritsar entry fee?
questions.contentDirection: Entry ₹250 for Indians, ₹500 foreigners. Located in Town Hall building. Include audio guide ₹100, photography charges, 2-3 hours duration, emotional content warning for sensitive visitors.

questions.question: How to witness Golden Temple morning prayers?
questions.contentDirection: Early morning Asa di Var kirtan starts 3 AM. Include Prakash ceremony timing, best viewing spots around sarovar, proper etiquette during prayers, photography restrictions during ceremonies.

questions.question: What vegetables are used in Amritsari kulcha?
questions.contentDirection: Popular varieties: aloo (potato), gobi (cauliflower), paneer, mixed vegetables, keema (non-veg). Include preparation method, accompaniments (chole, white butter, pickled onions), calorie content.

questions.question: Where to learn about Sikh history in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Central Sikh Museum inside Golden Temple (free), Partition Museum, Maharaja Ranjit Singh Museum. Include guided tour options ₹500-1500, historical timeline displays, artifact collections.

questions.question: What is the parking situation near Golden Temple?
questions.contentDirection: Paid parking ₹20-50. Main parking areas: Heritage Street, Ghanta Ghar area. Include walking distance (5-10 minutes), security arrangements, two-wheeler separate parking, peak hours congestion.

questions.question: How much money do I need for 3 days in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Budget: ₹3000-5000, Mid-range: ₹8000-12000, Luxury: ₹20000+. Breakdown accommodation, food (₹500-1500 daily), local transport, shopping, attraction entries. Include ATM availability.

questions.question: What is the weather like in Amritsar during winter?
questions.contentDirection: Dec-Feb temperatures 5-20°C. Include fog conditions affecting flights/trains, warm clothing requirements, best photography light conditions, festival celebrations during winter months.

questions.question: Where to experience traditional Punjabi culture in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Sadda Pind cultural village (₹800 entry), Gobindgarh Fort cultural shows, Heritage Street evening performances. Include folk dance shows, traditional games, cultural workshops timings.

questions.question: What are the airport connectivity options from Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Sri Guru Ram Dass Jee International Airport. Direct flights to Delhi, Mumbai, Bangalore. Airport to city 11 km, taxi ₹400-600, bus service ₹50-100. Include international connections via Dubai, UK.

questions.question: Where to buy traditional juttis in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Guru Bazaar, Katra Jaimal Singh. Varieties: Punjabi jutti (₹500-2000), Rajasthani style (₹300-1500). Include leather quality, sizing tips, custom embroidery options, bulk purchase discounts.

questions.question: What is Ram Tirath and how to visit?
questions.contentDirection: 12 km from city center, birthplace of Luv-Kush (Ramayana). Include bus service ₹30-50, temple timings, annual fair in November, boating facilities, picnic spot amenities.

questions.question: Where to see the making of Golden Temple?
questions.contentDirection: Information Center inside complex, Central Sikh Museum displays. Include historical timeline from 1577, architectural details, gold plating process, reconstruction history, Maharaja Ranjit Singh contributions.

questions.question: What street food is famous in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Kulcha-chole, Amritsari fish, papdi chaat near Hall Gate, samosa at Lawrence Road. Include hygiene tips, best eating hours (evening 5-9 PM), average costs ₹50-200 per item.

questions.question: How to attend the palki sahib ceremony at Golden Temple?
questions.contentDirection: Evening ceremony around 9:30 PM when Guru Granth Sahib is taken to rest. Include viewing positions, duration 30-45 minutes, photography etiquette, crowding during peak seasons.

questions.question: What are the nearby attractions to Amritsar within 100 km?
questions.contentDirection: Goindwal Sahib (30 km), Tarn Taran Sahib (25 km), Harike Wetland (60 km), Kapurthala (50 km). Include day trip options, bus connectivity, gurudwara accommodation facilities.

questions.question: Where to buy dry fruits in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Hall Bazaar dry fruit shops, Katra Ahluwalia market. Include Kashmiri walnuts, Afghan almonds, dates varieties. Price comparison with other cities, packaging for travel, quality identification tips.

questions.question: What is the significance of the four gates of Golden Temple?
questions.contentDirection: Four entrances representing openness to all directions and communities. Include names of gates, architectural features, symbolic meaning in Sikh philosophy, crowd management during peak hours.

questions.question: How to volunteer at Golden Temple langar?
questions.contentDirection: Direct registration at langar hall, various tasks (cooking, serving, cleaning). Include time commitments, dress code requirements, donation of ingredients, community service values, volunteer coordination.

questions.question: What photography rules apply at Golden Temple?
questions.contentDirection: Photography allowed in complex but restricted during prayers. Include dos and don'ts, best spots for shots, golden hour timing, commercial photography permissions, respectful photo practices.

questions.question: Where to experience Amritsar's textile heritage?
questions.contentDirection: Textile markets in Hall Bazaar, Phulkari workshops in old city, handloom centers. Include traditional weaving techniques, fabric varieties, pricing ₹200-2000 per meter, export quality options.

questions.question: What medical facilities are available for tourists in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Government hospitals: Civil Hospital, Private: Fortis Escorts. Include 24-hour pharmacies near Golden Temple, emergency numbers, travel insurance acceptance, common health issues in the region.

questions.question: How to experience Baisakhi festival in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: April 13-14 celebrations at Golden Temple, nagar kirtan processions, cultural programs. Include accommodation booking (2 months advance), crowd management, special langar preparations, folk performances.

questions.question: What is the mobile connectivity and internet situation in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Good 4G coverage by all major operators. Include WiFi availability at hotels, cafes, Golden Temple complex. SIM card purchase for tourists, data plan recommendations, international roaming costs.

questions.question: Where to buy religious books and items in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Book shops near Golden Temple complex, SGPC publication center. Include Guru Granth Sahib copies, religious artifacts, price ranges ₹100-5000, authenticity certificates for religious items.

questions.question: What are the lesser-known temples worth visiting in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Mata Lal Devi Temple, Shiv Mandir near Railway Station, Hanuman Mandir at Hall Gate. Include unique features, local legends, visiting hours, special prayer timings, community celebrations.

questions.question: How to plan a heritage walk in Amritsar old city?
questions.contentDirection: Self-guided route: Golden Temple → Jallianwala Bagh → Hall Bazaar → Partition Museum. Include 4-6 hour duration, heritage building identifications, local guide hiring ₹1000-2000, rest stops.

questions.question: What traditional games and sports can tourists experience in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Kabaddi at local grounds, wrestling at akharas, traditional Punjabi games at Sadda Pind. Include participation opportunities, viewing local competitions, sports equipment shopping, cultural significance.

questions.question: Where to find the best lassi varieties in Amritsar?
questions.contentDirection: Gian Di Lassi (famous), Ahuja Milk Bhandar, Bharawan Da Dhaba. Include flavors (plain, sweet, salted, fruit), prices ₹60-150, serving sizes, best consumption hours, health benefits.
